{{Day}}

==Events==
*[[752 BC]] &ndash; [[Romulus]], legendary first king of [[Ancient Rome|Rome]], celebrates the first [[Roman triumph]] after his victory over the [[Caenina (Town)|Caeninenses]], following [[The Rape of the Sabine Women]].
*[[509 BC]] &ndash; [[Publius Valerius Publicola]], [[Roman consul]], celebrates the first triumph of the [[Roman Republic]] after his victory over the deposed king [[Lucius Tarquinius Superbus]] at the [[Battle of Silva Arsia]].
*[[86 BC]] &ndash; [[Lucius Cornelius Sulla]], at the head of a [[Roman Republic]] army, enters [[Athens]], removing the [[tyrant]] [[Aristion]] who was supported by troops of [[Mithridates VI of Pontus]] ending the [[Siege of Athens and Piraeus (87–86 BC)|Siege of Athens and Piraeus]].
* [[293]] &ndash; Emperor [[Diocletian]] and [[Maximian]] appoint [[Constantius Chlorus]] and [[Galerius]] as [[Caesar (title)|Caesar]]s. This is considered the beginning of the [[Tetrarchy]], known as the ''Quattuor Principes Mundi'' ("Four Rulers of the World").
* [[317]] &ndash; [[Crispus]] and [[Constantine II (emperor)|Constantine II]], sons of [[Roman Emperor]] [[Constantine I]], and Licinius Iunior, son of Emperor [[Licinius]], are made ''[[Caesar (title)|Caesares]]''
* [[350]] &ndash; [[Vetranio]] is asked by [[Constantina]], sister of [[Constantius II]], to proclaim himself Caesar.
*[[1457]] &ndash; The ''[[Unitas Fratrum]]'' is established in the village of Kunvald, on the Bohemian-Moravian borderland. It is to date the second oldest Protestant denomination.
*[[1476]] &ndash; Forces of the [[Catholic Monarchs]] engage the combined Portuguese-Castilian armies of [[Afonso V of Portugal|Afonso V]] and [[John II of Portugal|Prince John]] at the [[Battle of Toro]].
*[[1562]] &ndash; Twenty-three [[Huguenot]]s are massacred by [[Catholicism|Catholics]] in [[Wassy]], [[France]], marking the start of the [[French Wars of Religion]].
*[[1565]] &ndash; The city of [[Rio de Janeiro]] is founded.
*[[1593]] &ndash; The [[Uppsala Synod]] is summoned to confirm the exact forms of the [[Lutheranism|Lutheran]] [[Church of Sweden]].
*[[1628]] &ndash; Writs issued in [[February]] by [[Charles I of England]] mandate that every county in [[England]] (not just seaport towns) pay [[ship tax]] by this date.
*[[1633]] &ndash; [[Samuel de Champlain]] reclaims his role as commander of [[New France]] on behalf of [[Cardinal Richelieu]].
*[[1642]] &ndash; Georgeana, [[Massachusetts]] (now known as [[York, Maine]]), becomes the first incorporated city in the [[United States]].
*[[1692]] &ndash; [[Sarah Good]], [[Sarah Osborne]] and [[Tituba]] are brought before local magistrates in [[Danvers, Massachusetts|Salem Village, Massachusetts]], beginning what would become known as the [[Salem witch trials]].
*[[1700]] &ndash; [[Sweden]] introduces its own [[Swedish calendar]], in an attempt to gradually merge into the [[Gregorian calendar]], reverts to the [[Julian calendar]] on this date in [[1712]], and introduces the [[Gregorian Calendar]] on this date in [[1753]].
*[[1713]] &ndash; The siege and destruction of [[Fort Neoheroka]] begins during the [[Tuscarora War]] in [[North Carolina]], effectively opening up the colony's interior to European colonization.
*[[1781]] &ndash; The [[Continental Congress]] adopts the [[Articles of Confederation]].
*[[1790]] &ndash; The first [[United States Census Bureau|United States census]] is authorized.
*[[1803]] &ndash; [[Ohio]] is admitted as the 17th [[U.S. state]].
*[[1805]] &ndash; Justice [[Samuel Chase]] is acquitted at the end of his [[impeachment]] trial by the [[U.S. Senate]].
*[[1811]] &ndash; Leaders of the [[Mameluke dynasty]] are killed by [[Egypt]]ian ruler [[Muhammad Ali of Egypt|Muhammad Ali]].
*[[1815]] &ndash; [[Napoleon I of France|Napoleon]] returns to [[France]] from his banishment on [[Elba]].
*[[1836]] &ndash; A [[Convention of 1836|convention]] of delegates from 57 [[Texas]] communities convenes in [[Washington-on-the-Brazos, Texas]], to deliberate independence from [[Mexico]].
*[[1845]] &ndash; [[President of the United States|President]] [[John Tyler]] signs a bill authorizing the [[United States]] to annex the [[Republic of Texas]].
*[[1847]] &ndash; The state of [[Michigan]] formally abolishes [[capital punishment]].
*[[1852]] &ndash; [[Archibald William Montgomerie, 13th Earl of Eglinton]] is appointed [[Lord Lieutenant of Ireland]].
*[[1854]] &ndash; [[German people|German]] psychologist [[Friedrich Eduard Beneke]] disappears; two years later his remains are found in a canal near [[Charlottenburg]].
*[[1867]] &ndash; [[Nebraska]] becomes the 37th [[U.S. state]]; Lancaster, [[Nebraska]] is renamed [[Lincoln, Nebraska|Lincoln]] and becomes the state capital.
*[[1868]] &ndash; The [[Pi Kappa Alpha]] Fraternity is founded at the [[University of Virginia]].
*[[1870]] &ndash; [[Francisco Solano López (politician)|Marshal F.S. López]] dies during the [[Battle of Cerro Corá]] thus marking the end of the [[Paraguayan War]].
*[[1872]] &ndash; [[Yellowstone National Park]] is established as the world's first [[national park]].
*[[1873]] &ndash; [[E. Remington and Sons]] in [[Ilion, New York]] begins production of the first practical [[typewriter]].
*[[1886]] &ndash; The [[Anglo-Chinese School]], [[Singapore]] is founded by [[Bishop]] [[William Fitzjames Oldham|William Oldham]].
*[[1893]] &ndash; Electrical engineer [[Nikola Tesla]] gives the first public demonstration of [[radio]] in [[St. Louis]], [[Missouri]].
*[[1896]] &ndash; [[Battle of Adowa]]: an [[Ethiopia]]n army defeats an outnumbered [[Kingdom of Italy|Italian]] force, ending the [[First Italo-Ethiopian War]].
*  1896   &ndash; [[Henri Becquerel]] discovers [[radioactivity]].
*[[1901]] &ndash; The [[Australian Army]] is formed.
*[[1910]] &ndash; The worst [[Wellington, Washington avalanche|avalanche]] in United States history buries a [[Great Northern Railway (U.S.)|Great Northern Railway]] train in northeastern [[King County, Washington]], killing 96 people.
*[[1912]] &ndash; [[Albert Berry (parachutist)|Albert Berry]] makes the first [[parachute]] jump from a moving [[airplane]].
*[[1914]] &ndash; The [[Republic of China (1912–49)|Republic of China]] joins the [[Universal Postal Union]].
*[[1917]] &ndash; The [[Government of the United States|U.S. government]] releases the [[plaintext|unencrypted text]] of the [[Zimmermann Telegram]] to the public.
*[[1919]] &ndash; [[March 1st Movement]] begins in [[Korea under Japanese rule]].
*[[1921]] &ndash; The [[Australia national cricket team|Australian cricket team]] captained by [[Warwick Armstrong]] becomes the first team to complete a [[whitewash (sport)|whitewash]] of [[The Ashes]], something that would not be repeated for 86 years.
*[[1932]] &ndash; The son of [[Charles Lindbergh]], [[Charles Augustus Lindbergh III]], is kidnapped.
*[[1936]] &ndash; The [[Hoover Dam]] is completed.
*  1936   &ndash; [[SS California strike|A strike occurs aboard the ''S.S. California'']], leading to the demise of the [[International Seamen's Union]] and the creation of the [[National Maritime Union]].
*[[1939]] &ndash; A [[Japanese Imperial Army]] ammunition dump explodes at [[Hirakata]], [[Osaka]], [[Japan]], killing 94.
*[[1941]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Bulgaria]] signs the [[Tripartite Pact]], allying itself with the [[Axis powers]].
*  1941   &ndash; [[W47NV]] (now known as [[WSM-FM]]) begins operations in [[Nashville, Tennessee]] becoming the first [[FM radio]] station in the [[United States|U.S.]].
*[[1946]] &ndash; The [[Bank of England]] is nationalised.
*[[1947]] &ndash; The [[International Monetary Fund]] begins financial operations.
*[[1950]] &ndash; [[Cold War]]: [[Klaus Fuchs]] is convicted of spying for the [[Soviet Union]] by disclosing top secret [[atomic bomb]] data.
*[[1953]] &ndash; Soviet Premier [[Joseph Stalin]] suffers a stroke and collapses; he dies four days later.
*[[1954]] &ndash; [[Nuclear testing]]: The [[Castle Bravo]], a 15-[[TNT equivalent|megaton]] [[hydrogen bomb]], is detonated on [[Bikini Atoll]] in the [[Pacific Ocean]], resulting in the worst [[radioactive contamination]] ever caused by the [[United States]].
*  1954   &ndash; [[Puerto Rican independence movement|Puerto Rican nationalists]] attack the [[United States Capitol]] building, [[United States Capitol shooting incident (1954)|injuring five Representatives]].
*[[1956]] &ndash; The [[International Air Transport Association]] finalizes a draft of the [[Radiotelephony spelling alphabet]] for the [[International Civil Aviation Organization]].
*  1956   &ndash; Formation of the [[East Germany|East German]] [[National People's Army|Nationale Volksarmee]]
*[[1958]] &ndash; [[Samuel Stritch|Samuel Alphonsus Stritch]] is appointed [[Pro-Prefect]] of the [[Propagation of Faith]] and thus becomes the first [[United States|American]] member of the [[Roman Curia]].
*[[1961]] &ndash; [[President of the United States|American President]] [[John F. Kennedy]] establishes the [[Peace Corps]].
*  1961   &ndash; [[Uganda]] becomes self-governing and holds its first elections.
*[[1962]] &ndash; [[American Airlines Flight 1]] crashes on take off in [[New York]].
*[[1964]] &ndash; [[Villarrica (volcano)|Villarrica Volcano]] begins a [[strombolian eruption]] causing [[lahar]]s that destroy half of the town of [[Coñaripe]].
*[[1966]] &ndash; [[Venera 3]] [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] [[space probe]] crashes on [[Venus]] becoming the first [[spacecraft]] to land on another [[planet]]'s surface.
*  1966   &ndash; The [[Ba'ath Party]] takes power in [[Syria]].
*[[1971]] &ndash; A bomb explodes in a men's room in the [[United States Capitol]]: the [[Weatherman (organization)|Weather Underground]] claims responsibility.
*  1971   &ndash; [[President of Pakistan]] [[Yahya Khan]] indefinitely postpones the pending national assembly session, precipitating massive civil disobedience in [[East Pakistan]].
*[[1972]] &ndash; The [[Thailand|Thai]] province of [[Yasothon province|Yasothon]] is created after being split off from the [[Ubon Ratchathani province]].
*[[1973]] &ndash; [[Black September (group)|Black September]] storms the [[Saudi Arabia|Saudi]] embassy in [[Khartoum]], [[Sudan]], resulting in the [[Attack on the Saudi embassy in Khartoum|assassination of three Western hostages]].
*[[1974]] &ndash; [[Watergate scandal]]: Seven are indicted for their role in the Watergate break-in and charged with conspiracy to obstruct justice.
*[[1981]] &ndash; [[Provisional Irish Republican Army]] member [[Bobby Sands]] begins his [[1981 Irish hunger strike|hunger strike]] in [[Maze (HM Prison)|HM Prison Maze]].
*[[1989]] &ndash; The [[United States]] becomes a member of the [[Berne Convention for the Protection of Literary and Artistic Works]].
*[[1990]] &ndash; [[Steve Jackson Games]] is raided by the [[United States Secret Service]], prompting the later formation of the [[Electronic Frontier Foundation]].
*[[1992]] &ndash; [[Bosnia and Herzegovina]] declares its independence from [[Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia]].
*[[1995]] &ndash; [[Prime Minister of Poland]] [[Waldemar Pawlak]] resigns from parliament and is replaced by ex-[[communist]] [[Józef Oleksy]].
*  1995   &ndash; [[Yahoo!]] is incorporated.
*[[1998]] &ndash; ''[[Titanic (1997 film)|Titanic]]'' became the first film to gross over [[List of highest-grossing films|$1 billion worldwide]].
*[[1999]] &ndash; [[Ottawa Treaty]] enters into force.
*[[2000]] &ndash; The [[Constitution of Finland]] is rewritten.
*  2000   &ndash;  [[Hans Blix]] assumes the position of Executive [[Chairman]] of [[UNMOVIC]].
*[[2002]] &ndash; [[War in Afghanistan (2001–present)|U.S. invasion of Afghanistan]]: [[Operation Anaconda]] begins in eastern [[Afghanistan]].
*  2002   &ndash; The [[Envisat]] [[environmental satellite]] successfully reaches an orbit {{convert|800|km|mi|sp=us}} above the [[Earth]] on its 11th launch, carrying the heaviest [[payload (air and space craft)|payload]] to date at 8500 kilograms (8.5 tons).
*  2002   &ndash; The [[Spanish peseta|peseta]] is discontinued as official [[currency]] of [[Spain]] and is replaced by the [[euro]] (€).
*[[2003]] &ndash; Management of the [[United States Customs Service]] and the [[United States Secret Service]] move to the [[United States Department of Homeland Security]].
*  2003   &ndash; The [[International Criminal Court]] holds its inaugural session in [[The Hague]].
*[[2004]] &ndash; [[Mohammed Bahr al-Uloum]] becomes [[President of Iraq]].
*[[2005]] &ndash; [[Supreme Court of the United States|U.S. Supreme Court]] rules that the execution of juveniles found guilty of murder is unconstitutional marking a change in "national standards,".
*[[2006]] &ndash; [[English language|English-language]] [[Wikipedia]] reaches its one millionth article, [[Jordanhill railway station]].
*[[2007]] &ndash; [[Tornado]]es [[February–March 2007 Tornado Outbreak|break out across]] the [[southern United States]], killing at least 20; eight of the deaths are at [[Enterprise High School (Alabama)|a high school]] in [[Enterprise, Alabama|Enterprise]], [[Alabama]].
*  2007   &ndash; [[Squatting|"Squatters"]] are [[Eviction|evicted]] from [[Ungdomshuset]] in [[Copenhagen]], [[Denmark]], provoking the [[March 2007 Denmark Riots]].
*[[2008]] &ndash; The [[Police of the Republic of Armenia|Armenian police]] clash with peaceful opposition rally protesting against [[Armenian presidential election, 2008|allegedly fraudulent presidential elections 2008]], as a result ten people are killed.
*[[2014]] &ndash; At least 29 people are killed and 130 injured in a [[2014 Kunming attack|mass stabbing]] at [[Kunming Railway Station]] in [[China]].

==Holidays and observances==
* [[Beer Day (Iceland)|Beer Day]], marked the end of [[beer]] [[prohibition]] in [[1989]] ([[Iceland]])
*Christian [[Feast Day]]:
**[[Saint Albin|Albin]]
**[[Saint David|David]]
**[[Saint Monan|Monan]]
**[[Suitbert of Kaiserwerdt|Suitbert]]
**[[March 1 (Eastern Orthodox liturgics)]]
*Earliest day on which [[Casimir Pulaski Day]] can fall, while March 7 is the latest; celebrated on the first Monday in March. ([[Illinois]])
*Earliest day on which [[Laetare Sunday]] can fall, while April 4 is the latest; celebrated on the fourth Sunday of [[Lent]]. ([[Western Christianity]]), and its related observances:
**[[Carnival#Belgium|Carnaval de la Laetare]] ([[Stavelot]])
**[[Mothering Sunday]] ([[United Kingdom]])
*[[Independence Day (Bosnia and Herzegovina)|Independence Day]], celebrates the independence of [[Bosnia and Herzegovina]] from Socialist Federal Republic of [[Yugoslavia]] in 1992.
*[[March 1st Movement|March 1st Movement Remembrance Day or ''Samiljeol;'' 삼일절]] ([[South Korea]])
*[[Martenitsa]] ([[Bulgaria]])
*[[Mărțișor]] ([[Romania]] and [[Moldova]])
*[[National Pig Day]] ([[United States]])
*[[Roman Empire|Roman]] [[New Year]] observances:
**Feriae Marti in honor of [[Mars (god)|Mars]]
**[[Matronalia]] in honor of [[Juno (mythology)|Juno]]
**Renewal of the [[Sacred fire of Vesta|Vestal fire]]
*[[Saint David's Day|Saint David's Day or ''Dydd Gŵyl Dewi Sant'']] ([[Wales]] and Welsh communities)
*[[Self Injury Awareness Day]]
*The final day (fourth or fifth) of [[Ayyám-i-Há]] ([[Bahá'í Faith]])
*[[International_observance#March|World Civil Defence Day]] ([[International observance|international]])
